senses.de: Ability to bend easily without breaking
senses.ex: The gymnast is flexible enough to touch her toes without bending her knees.

Tips.title: Physical Context
Tips.description: Use 'flexible' for describing physical traits emphasizing ease and grace in movement.
Tips.example: My yoga teacher is so flexible, she can do complex poses with ease.

Tips.title: Not Fragile
Tips.description: 'Flexible' implies strength as well as softness; it doesn't mean something is weak.
Tips.example: Rubber bands are flexible yet strong enough to hold things together.

senses.de: Ready and able to change so as to adapt to different circumstances
senses.ex: You need to be flexible to work in a dynamic and fast-paced environment.

Tips.title: Willingness to Change
Tips.description: 'Flexible' in this sense is positive, suggesting someone can adapt willingly to changes.
Tips.example: Despite the sudden rain, her flexible attitude allowed us to still have fun.

Tips.title: Work Environment
Tips.description: In job descriptions, 'flexible' often means you might have to work unusual or changing hours.
Tips.example: The job requires a flexible person who can work nights and weekends when needed.

senses.ex: A kitchen knife is a flexible tool that can be used for chopping, slicing, and dicing.

Tips.title: Utility and Function
Tips.description: 'Flexible' can describe something practical for various needs or purposes.
Tips.example: My phone's flexible case also serves as a stand for watching videos.

senses.ex: Our vacation plans are flexible, we can change them if we find a better deal.

Tips.title: Plan Adjustments
Tips.description: Using 'flexible' for plans suggests they can be changed with little hassle or stress.
Tips.example: We kept our weekend plans flexible so we could join if the weather was good.

senses.de: Ability to be easily modified to respond to altered circumstances
senses.ex: This software is flexible, it can be easily adapted to meet the needs of any company.

Tips.title: Tech Customization
Tips.description: In technology, 'flexible' refers to software or systems that can be tailored to different needs.
Tips.example: Our new app is flexible, offering various settings to cater to user preferences.

Tips.title: Evolving Usage
Tips.description: In computing, 'flexible' means the technology can evolve with changing trends or requirements.
Tips.example: The flexible platform can integrate new features as market demands shift.

Adapt.wordDefinition:
Adapt means to change or modify oneself, or something else, to fit new or different circumstances. For example, a plant that adapts to a new climate or an individual who adapts to a new job.

Adaptation is a process, while being flexible is a characteristic. You adapt when something changes, and you are flexible if you can handle those changes easily.

Adapting is useful when facing extreme changes, while being flexible can be useful in everyday life.

Ductile.wordDefinition:
Ductile refers to the ability of a material to be molded or stretched without breaking. It generally applies to metals that can be made into wires or sheets.

In simpler terms, ductile is like Play-Doh that can be stretched and molded into different shapes without breaking, like metal wires.

Elastic.wordDefinition:
Elastic and flexible both refer to the ability of a material or object to deform or bend, but there is a slight difference in their meanings.

Elastic refers to something that can deform and then quickly return to its original shape, like a rubber band.

It can stretch and then snap back into place or bounce back. For example, an elastic waistband on a pair of pants can stretch to fit comfortably around the wearer's waist, but then snap back into shape when the pants are removed.

Elastic describes something that can stretch and then return to its original shape, while flexible describes something that can bend or deform without breaking.

Limb.wordDefinition:
Limb refers to an arm or a leg, and is only applicable to the human body or animals.

A limb is a part of the body that extends from the torso and is used for movement.

For example, your arms and legs are limbs because they help you walk, run, and do other physical activity.

Flexible refers to the ability to bend without breaking, whereas limb refers specifically to a part of the body used for movement.

Malleable.wordDefinition:
Malleable describes something that can be easily shaped or molded, like clay or metal that can be hammered into a new form.

Flexible applies to things that can bend and adjust without breaking, while malleable applies to things that can be transformed into a new shape or form.

Pliable.wordDefinition:
Flexible and pliable are both adjectives used to describe something that can be bent or distorted without breaking.

However, flexible usually implies something that can be bent easily and repeatedly without losing its shape or structure, while pliable implies something that can be bent or shaped easily but may not necessarily return to its original shape.

A piece of clay is pliable because it can be easily molded into different shapes, but once it dries and hardens, it cannot be reshaped.

Pliable is often used to describe softer materials like fabrics or clay that can be easily shaped or molded.

Resilient.wordDefinition: Flexible means something can bend or adjust easily without breaking, while the word resilient means something can recover quickly from difficulties or setbacks.

Supple.wordDefinition:
Supple refers to something that is soft and pliable, with the ability to be bent or shaped easily. For example, a piece of leather can be supple.

Generally, flexible describes objects or materials, while supple describes things like muscles or certain fabrics.

Versatile.wordDefinition:
Versatile means being capable of doing many things competently. It is applicable when something or someone can perform a wide variety of tasks or activities.

For example, a multi-tool can be described as versatile because it can be used for many different purposes such as cutting, sawing, or screw-driving.

In other words, flexible refers to something that can physically bend or adapt, while versatile refers to something or someone that can perform a wide variety of tasks or activities competently.

quotes.Text: When you're guest-starring on another show, it really requires you to jump through hoops in a way, because you're servicing the stories of the main characters. You have to be able to portray a lot of different elements. You show up and get on board and get on their journey; you have to be flexible as to what they need for the role.
quotes.Title: American Actress
quotes.Name: Kim Dickens

quotes.Text: We control the world basically because we are the only animals that can cooperate flexibly in very large numbers. And if you examine any large-scale human cooperation, you will always find that it is based on some fiction like the nation, like money, like human rights.
quotes.Title: Israeli Historian
quotes.Name: Yuval Noah Harari

quotes.Text: Computers seem a little too adaptively flexible, like the strange natives, odd societies, and head cases we study in the social sciences. There's more opposable thumb in the digital world than I care for; it's awfully close to human.
quotes.Title: American Comedian
quotes.Name: P. J. O'Rourke

quotes.Text: Failed plans should not be interpreted as a failed vision. Visions don't change, they are only refined. Plans rarely stay the same, and are scrapped or adjusted as needed. Be stubborn about the vision, but flexible with your plan.
quotes.Title: American Clergyman
quotes.Name: John C. Maxwell

quotes.Text: The pleasure of writing fiction is that you are always spotting some new approach, an alternative way of telling a story and manipulating characters; the novel is such a wonderfully flexible form.
quotes.Title: English Author
quotes.Name: Penelope Lively

quotes.Text: The only way to really portray a character and tell a story well is to be flexible internally. And one of the ways we're blocked as actors is being aware of where our bodies are carrying tension.
quotes.Title: Canadian Actress
quotes.Name: Kristin Lehman

quotes.Text: I started to do yoga. It helps for the body to be more flexible but also for the mind - it calms me down a lot, so I really like to do that.
quotes.Name: Kiki Bertens

quotes.Text: Reading poetry gives me a sense of calm, well-being, and love for humanity - the same stuff more flexible women get from yoga.
quotes.Title: American Novelist
quotes.Name: J. Courtney Sullivan

quotes.Text: I think it's important to be flexible and free, and you can't be free and spontaneous if you don't know what you're doing.
quotes.Title: American Actress
quotes.Name: Krysten Ritter

quotes.Text: Nobody who knows me and loves me dearly would ever call me adaptable or flexible. I'm not.
quotes.Title: American Author
quotes.Name: Judith Viorst
